design_notes: One twist per scenario is recommended.
Twists should recontextualize objectives, not replace them.
Selection should be weighted by plot_family bias, danger level, escalation cause, and active resources.
Tags are used for filtering and weighting, not for direct player-facing text.

twists.name: The Resource Is a Decoy
twists.description: The objective was never the real prize. Its purpose was misdirection.
example_outcomes: The cargo is inert, spoiled, fake, or symbolic.
Destroying it completes its true purpose.

twists.name: The Resource Has a Hidden Cost
twists.description: Using or extracting the resource causes an unseen consequence.
example_outcomes: It shortens the lifespan of users or tools.

twists.name: The Monster Was Holding Something Back
twists.description: The apparent threat was containing something far worse.
example_outcomes: Killing the monster releases a greater horror.
The monster was territorial for a reason.

twists.name: The Objective Is Not What It Appears To Be
twists.description: The objective changes meaning once interacted with.
example_outcomes: The device is a key, not a weapon.
The captive is a focus, not a victim.
The structure is alive or aware.

twists.name: Ownership Is Symbolic
twists.description: Control matters more than possession or destruction.
example_outcomes: Holding the site confers influence elsewhere.
Destroying it empowers a rival belief.

twists.name: The Location Awakens or Rejects Control
twists.description: The land itself responds to events.
example_outcomes: The ground shifts, seals, or opens.

twists.name: Victory Conditions Invert
twists.description: Winning now requires doing the opposite of the original goal.

twists.name: An Unexpected Third Party Intervenes
twists.description: A new force arrives with its own agenda.
example_outcomes: A monster migrates into the area.

twists.name: Success Leaves a Scar
twists.description: Even victory permanently alters the canyon.

twists.name: Belief Was the Real Resource
twists.description: Faith, fear, or legend was the true objective.
example_outcomes: A cult gains or loses power.
